name: commenting_conventions
rule: All generated code should include context comments.
details: At the beginning of a module, include a comprehensive outline of the module's purpose, main functions, and overall structure.
Within modules, add comments to explain complex logic, non-obvious decisions, or critical sections of code.
path_to_scripting: This rule can be implemented by integrating LLM-driven comment generation into the agent's code generation process. After generating a block of code, the agent's LLM would be prompted to generate comments that adhere to the specified conventions. For module-level comments, the LLM would summarize the module's purpose and structure. For in-line comments, the LLM would explain complex logic or non-obvious decisions. This ensures that all generated code is well-documented and easy to understand.
